fileManagerAPI

Class FileReader<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileManagerAPI.CommonFileOperations<E,java.io.BufferedReader>
      • fileManagerAPI.FileReader<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - generic type of data returned by the method manipulateFile().
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileManager<E,java.io.BufferedReader>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Reader

    public abstract class FileReader<E>
extends CommonFileOperations<E,java.io.BufferedReader>
    This class implements the operations used to be able to read the lines from a file. Moreover, it propagates the implementation of the method manipulateFile() through the modifier abstract. To Note that the generic type of data T, defined in FileManager and propagate in CommonFileOperations has been fixed in this class to be an BufferedReader object.

    A call to the function openFile() will generate the proper initialization of the data returned by getFileMatipolator() with respect to the parameters given in inputs to the constructor. Since file manipulator is of rime BufferedReader it is possible to loop along all the lines of a file using:
      String line = getFileMatipolator().readLine();
      While( line != null){
          // do something
           ....
          line = getFileMatipolator().readLine();
      }
    To make permanent the changes over the file closeFile() should be called. This will also effect the value of the reader: getFileMatipolator(). It must be reinitialized to be used again.
    Author:
    Buoncompagni Luca
    See Also:
    CommonFileOperations, FileManager

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileReader

        public FileReader(java.lang.String path,
          java.lang.Boolean isRelative)
        Constructor which just call the construction of CommonFileOperations and does not process any further the data.
        Parameters:
        path - is the directory path to the file in relative or absolute notation.
        isRelative - if it is true, it identifies that the parameter path defines a relative path. Otherwise, if it is false, it denotes that the parameter path is an absolute address.

    • Method Detail

      • manipulateFile

        public abstract E manipulateFile()
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Do something on the file. This method need to open, manipulate and close the file. It also has to consider possible input/output Exception that this may cause.
        Specified by:
        manipulateFile in interface FileManager<E,java.io.BufferedReader>
        Specified by:
        manipulateFile in class CommonFileOperations<E,java.io.BufferedReader>
        Returns:
        a generic type of data to notify that all operations has been correctly performed. Or it may return a data generated by the manipulations.
